column4: hey guys, im running feisty but i think this should be pretty universal, i can't seem to get my network card working on my laptop
wireless network card*
that's not as conforting as you may think
for some reason iwconfig wlan0 says no such device
type only iwconfig to see if it changed interface name.. perhaps
all i get is lo no wireless extensions; eth0 no wireless extensions
ok, i had wlan and eth1 mixing from time to time... thats why i said that...
perhaps bad driver?
ok how do i wipe the driver and start over?
compile it and insmod it /modprobe it
i have no idea what that means
i appears to be B-2 on that page
did it ever worked? is rt2??? name of module u use?
what's rt2? and actually this laptop has only had windows up to this point, and it did work there
i use a broadcom bcm4318
ok, then... u need to boot live cd on it and to see what is ur wcard; like this:
after u find out which one is u go for chase of driver perhaps it will work out of the box!
it didn't work out of the box which is why i went after ndiswrapper
Broadcom Corporation BCM4318 [AirForce One 54g]  802.11g Wireless Lan Controller (rev 02)
aha, ok, then u need to tell us what is maker of that wireless card chipset so we look up in here http://ndiswrapper.sourceforge.net/mediawiki/index.php/List
ok, u can watch i am already helping to Sp4cedOut collegue
yes i see that
before lodaing (sudo modprobe ndiswrapper) u need to rmmod bcm43xx and blacklist it...
